content.description: Sit start on crimpy holds and bump through the first few moves, the features get bigger and further apart as you go so shifting your body weight feels more natural on this problem.
content.location: This problem is about 22 feet east of Piton Rock.

content.description: Sit start to two bench size ledges, good warm up.
content.location: Same boulder as Sliced Lotus

content.description: Sit start on this little boulder and enjoy a 3 to 5 move climb.
content.location: Ying is about 160ft west from Above the Crowds boulder, about 60ft off the right side of the trail.

content.description: Same low start as Ying but throwing out right for slopey hold, topping out far right of Ying
content.location: Right of Ying

content.description: I won't give too much away on this problem. It is a sit start that moves into a slight overhang with sloped holds. (crux near bottom)
content.location: The cave like corner below Invisible Ladder

content.description: This traverse starts hanging upside down on lower right ledge, lots of heel hooking play, ending with a high left bomber hold to top out.
content.location: On the other side of the trail just opposite of Natural Showmanship.

content.description: Sit start with a nice right handed jug and left hand on crimpy feature, lunge up to a high left crimper, controlled static moves make this problem flow better.
content.location: Left of Philosophers Stone

content.description: Same sit start as Zen Steps but bumps straight up over an obvious ledge to finish
content.location: Right of Zen Steps

content.description: Lay back on a good right hand hold and far left under cling to balance, throw for a very high left hold to match on, move up onto good holds and reach over the lip for solid crimpers to top out.
content.location: This problem is up hill from Cling to the Present and recessed in the ground.

content.description: Small crimpy holds for the first 3-4 moves then move into the corner for the top.
content.location: Same boulder as Granola Sucks

content.description: Matching sit start on bottom left corner, it's bumping heaven from there.
content.location: Same boulder as Cling to the Present

content.description: Great holds, solid footing from start to finish. Add a matching sit start for variation.
Start on the same left ledge as Diogenes Posture, match on the triangular hold to the right then straight up to finish.
content.location: Under Diogenes Posture

content.description: Start on right side, gym like holds with good feet.
content.location: Just opposite of Socrates Dilemma

content.description: Start in lower right corner, follow diagonally up to the left, same top out as Lucky Streak.
content.location: Right of Lucky Streak

content.description: Many variations, Very balancy.
content.location: Same boulder as Floating Monk.

content.description: Sit start on undercling and follow the left corner up to finish.
content.location: This problem is a short distance from Floating Monk.

content.description: Beautifully spaced two and three finger holds work up the middle of the boulder.
content.location: The boulder next to Zen Steps.

content.description:
Sit start with your left hand on a crimp and your right hand slightly above on a sloper. Your right foot should press against any small ruffle in the overhang, although there is no obvious foot hold. The rock has so much friction that it will feel much better than a real foot chip at somewhere like purple stones or stoney point.

The left foot should heel hook the south east face of the wall. Pull yourself up to a one inch ledge. Either match or get your right hand there and then grip a vertical  4 finger pocket a centimeter deep with your left hand. Heel hook the left hand starting crimp and do a foot switch. Traverse the wall without using the top until you get to the end of the left side and then mantle. The crux is the foot switch as you climb out of the overhang. (this is just a suggested beta). V1+ for people who are slab wall oriented. V0 for people who are core  and foot work oriented.

Titled false zen steps due to the possibility for confusion in their description.
content.location:
Latitude 34.280 Longitude -117.641

30-40 feet east of Piton Rock, facing southeast.

content.description:
Same start as false zen steps. Go off to the right instead of the left to an obvious ledge with obvious jugs and then mantle, just like in the real zen steps and Sliced Lotus. Use slanted rock inbetween the undercling and the southeast face to press with your feet to get out of the undercling.

Go straight up and mantle for a V0.
content.location: To the left of False Zen steps, same start. Coordinates in false zen steps location.

content.description: Grab a good outside edge and right hand on a slopey feature, pull yourself onto the boulder with a compression move until you slap for solid high left edge. bump out right towards the top for finishing moves.
content.location: Most northern boulder up slope.

content.description: Start far left over a big ledge traversing and heel hooking to the right, throw for great holds to top out on far right.
content.location: Head straight for the dense rock field just feet from Ying/Yang, this is a south facing boulder.

content.description: Sit start on lower left edge, reach for great rails to top out.
content.location: Just north (uphill) of Lazy Day.

content.description: flow and relax up this short fun problem.
content.location: about 50 feet south west of Cling to the Present boulder

content.description: Bottom right start, move left over the corner on good holds.
content.location: This will be the first boulder you encounter as you approach the area. The top of this boulder is visible about 50 feet off the right side of the trail. As you near the top of the hill just before the Rock Garden comes into view. Please tread lightly past plant life to make your way to this boulder.
